alert.note: Alert for Northern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued December 25 at 4:56PM MST until December 26 at 5:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST SUNDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM SUNDAY TO 5 PM MST MONDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY WILL EXPIRE AT 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning Sunday morning through Monday afternoon, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 45 below zero. For the Wind Chill Advisory tonight, wind chills as low as 30 below zero. * WHERE...Northern Rocky Mountain Front. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, from 5 AM Sunday to 5 PM MST Monday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 5 AM MST Sunday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
